title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 260.1 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 260.1 - General

State Regulations

Pursuant to article 30-B of the Tax Law, a city having a
population of more than 190,000 but less than 215,000 inhabitants is authorized
to impose a tax on the earnings of nonresidents derived from within such city
at a rate not to exceed the rate provided for therein. The city earnings tax on
nonresidents authorized to be imposed pursuant to article 30-B of the Tax Law
is to be administered and collected, including the administration and
collection of nonresident earnings tax required to be withheld by employers, by
the Department of Taxation and Finance. Local Law No. 8, as amended by Local

Law No. 9, of the City of Yonkers Laws of 1984 added article X to the Codes and

Ordinances of the City of Yonkers to impose the city earnings tax on
nonresidents authorized pursuant to the authority of article 30-B of the Tax

Law, and vested the administration and collection of such city earnings tax on
nonresidents with the Department of Taxation and Finance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
260.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
